page.title: 19CROFTING-TEANASSIE AREA
page.content: Crofts are common in our area.Crofting is hard work and there is little time for leisure.Sheep are kept and their lambs are sold for around Â£30 each.A fleece is sold for about Â£7.Cows are kept on a croft for milk.Hill cattle are also kept and are sold for about Â£400-Â£600 per animal.Clydsedale Horses used to do most of the work on the croft but now crofters use tractors. Most crofters have about 10-30 acres of land.In a crofter's family nobody is idle.Everyone helps with the harvest. Barley,oats and wheat are grown.Women usually feed the lambs and the chickens if any are kept.On the croft in spring crofters have to plough and sow the land.If they grow potatoes the majority are sold but they keep some for their own use.
